text:
A quick update.  I just built on Windows Vista and it built successfully, so it appears the issue is only on Linux; however, it fails on two different Linux boxes, so I don't know if it is an issue with just Linux or if there are other items causing the issue.

FYI, I tried it with both JDK 1.5 & 1.6 on Linux.  The successful build on Vista was with JDK 1.6.

Let me know if you need more info on my Linux installation or other installation/configuration parameters if you have trouble repro'ing.

I guess it's not a Windows vs. Unix problem.

There was a bug in the module build system: The module classpath contained lenya-*-api.jar, which included all modules that were built before and not only the core API and the modules dependencies. Due to the non-deterministic build order, it sometimes worked and sometimes not. I have now fixed this issue and added the missing dependencies. If the problem persists, please re-open the bug.
creator: andreas@apache.org

text: BTW, you need to issue a "build clean" after the update or at least rm WEB-INF/lib/*.jar because the module JAR names changed (they now contain the version number).
creator: andreas@apache.org
lance@lancehendrix.com
text:
After getting the latest from the svn repo and issuing ./build.sh clean-all, I was able to build successfully.

I looked for guidance regarding bug/issue procedures, but was not able to find any on the lenya site.  In my experience, the person that opened a bug should be the one to close, therefore, I will mark the issue closed.

Thanks for the fix/resolution!
